Posts.Title: My Mother Is Sleeping Now BrokenHeart marieibrahim

Posts.Content: hopetoheal wrote: Hi to all. I think I need to hear some encourageing words. My mom is diagnosed with IV stage, liver met bc.She took the first chemo and next week she will take the second. After the second one, they will control her and if the tumor on liver heals, they will make surgery to take the breast. After surgery, she will take chemo, radio, and so on. She is %30 ER +, PR- and HER+ She is only 46 and I have a 11 year old sister. I am very stressfull and wanted to hear the story if somebody has the similar experience. Thank you for your replies. Posts.Title: Anybody diagnosed with liver met? hopetoheal hopetoheal

Posts.Content: Mar 16, 2011 09:20AM - edited Mar 17, 2011 02:56AM by hopetoheal Nil is a friend of mine from the first day i became a member of this wonderful .org page, for my stage 4 diagnosed mum.We found eachother by coincidence and after some talk, we discovered that we were born at the same year, in the same country, even the same city on the world. We kept talking on Turkish and I saw the preciousness of her heart and soul.She didn't complain even one time although she very much had side affects of the chemos. I told her about my mum and she let me know about herself. We became sisters. I am so happy that God let me meet her on this web site. She gave me the inspiration to thank God for all the situations on this world.She reminded me this is a temporary world and all things we are living are parts of a big exam for the entrance to heaven. I saw her strenght and thankfulness to God although she was 27 and battling a stupid enemy. I really like this girl from my heart and pray god to ease her victory at this battle of her. Nilüfer, you are my sister on the other end of the world .Remember we had plans that you will come to Turkey after your treatment ends.I will make you meet with my mum, another victorious like you! And will eat baklava of course ! :)

Posts.Content: Feb 24, 2010 05:37AM hopetoheal wrote: Dear down16, the hardest part of this treatment is the diagnosis week. My mom was really down when she heard the diagnosis stage 4 , mets to liver. But after the first 10 day, and especially after the first checks up, and see that it began to shrink, you physology will be better. You have to just wait the time pass.Please do not forget that stage 4 is not as same as the other type of cancers' stage4. We are luckiest ones of unluckiests. Take care.
Posts.Title: Liver Mets dawn16 dawn16

Posts.Content: May 4, 2010 07:32AM hopetoheal wrote: My mum also was first diagnosed with liver met, they did not make surgery. They gave herceptin and the liver tumor disappeared. After 5 months of this process, they made the surgery. She will contiune to take herceptin addition to a new red chemo.

Posts.Title: Please share how breastcancer.org has impacted you.... Moderators BouncingBetties

Posts.Content: Jan 8, 2010 06:53AM hopetoheal wrote: Hi, my mom is also diagnosed as breast ca with a 1 cm liver tumor  this December. She began to take herceptin and after 3 dose, they will send her to ultrasound test and if it is disappeared, then the surgery will be done.I It is a very short time since december but I hope to be a long and healty living example for you in time.
Posts.Title: Liver Mets Survivors gma5279 tami444

Posts.Content: Jan 22, 2010 08:53AM hopetoheal wrote: Dear quarter, before chemo, the doc wanted a biopsy from liver to determine whether it is in compliance with the tumor in breast, or it is a new and other tumor. The result showed that they have the same characteristics and Her+ . So they began to give herceptin. Today she is taking the third chemo, she will be controlled after a short time if the one in liver is healed. The process is like that in our situation.
Posts.Title: Liver Mets Survivors gma5279 tami444

Posts.Content: Feb 18, 2010 04:41PM - edited Feb 18, 2010 04:46PM by hopetoheal Same thing happened to my mum, but instead of giving chemo to understand whether iti is tumor or not, her doctor just wanted a pet scan to understand it. After pet scan, they saw it is a 1,8 cm tumor.That is she is stage 4. They made biopsy to understand whether it has same receptors with the one in breast. They were the same, so the chemo began. After 3 dose of herceptin, it is 0,8 cm now :) After the tumor on liver heals, they willl make surgery to take the breast. Please don't be scared. It heals even if it is a tumor, but it may be irrelevant with tumor because liver takes everythinng to its memory, even a childhood  age kick.
